result.execSummary:
The defendant Joseph L. Stein was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Burglary-Building or Dwelling [Modifiers: Repeater], a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.10(1m)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.  This applies to all counts and financial obligations.

Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent.  
*  Pay supervision fees.  
Do not possess or consume alcoholic beverages and do not have alcoholic beverages within the residence.  Do not possess or consume controlled substances, except by prescription.  Do not be in taverns or on any premises licensed for the sale of intoxicating beverages, except restaurants or grocery stores.  Submit voluntarily to random tests of blood, breath or urine.  Participate in counseling deemed appropriate by agent.  Actively search for employment, be employed or attend an educational institution or vocational training program.  
*  Pay all court costs including all applicable surcharges.  
*  DNA surcharge is waived.    
*  Pay restitution in the sum of $7517.64  plus surcharges. 
Deft stips to restitution.    May not possess any weapons, including firearms.

records.addlTxt: Extending Probation for Unpaid Court Obligations
Extending Probation for Unpaid Court Obligations

11:01 AM All parties appear by zoom. Attorney Emily Trigg appeared by video means for Plaintiff State of Wisconsin Prosecuting Atty  appeared for State of Wisconsin. Defendant Joseph L. Stein appeared by video means. Probation Agent Christina Munger appeared by video means.  Clerk: H.Naydihor.  Agent reports DE has not made a good faith effort to pay the restitution.  DE agrees to extension.  Court grants extenstion for 1 year.  PA to file order for extenstion.
Christina Munger.  Return to sender.  Not deliverable as addressed.  Unable to forward. (put in P&P pick up bin in 204)

Probation review hearing on January 13, 2021 at 11:00 am.  Outstanding restitution and court costs.  If paid in full prior to this date the hearing will be cancelled.   Parties to appear via video conferencing. Instructions to join the hearing are provided with this notice.  Pursuant to Wisconsin's Supreme Court Order issued March 22, 2020 this hearing being held via video and telephone conferencing. Any person entering a courtroom is required to wear a mask.

Ct. 2
Assessment Report

Conditions of Probation Imposed by the Judge - Ct 1

Defendant Joseph L. Stein appeared with Attorney Kristyne Watson.  Defendant in custody @ Jackson Corrections.  Attorney Emily Trigg appeared for the Prosecution.  Court Reporter:  Cyndi Chike.  Clerk: J. Mattner.
MINUTES:  Victim rights compliance.  Def. serving a prison sentence til 3/16/16 on another case.  Ct 2 was dismissed and read-in.
Ct 1:
Court orders withheld sentence; defendant placed on probation for 2 years w/conditions, consecutive to 07CF593 & 11CF59.  No sentence credit given.  Court costs ordered.  Restitution of $7,517 ordered; def. stipulate to rest. amount.  Federal firearms warning and voter ineligibility status given to the defendant.  DNA sample previously submitted, surcharge waived.  Appeal rights given.

Defendant Joseph L. Stein appeared with Attorney Kristyne Watson.  Defendant in custody @ Jackson Corrections.  Attorney Emily Trigg appeared for the Prosecution.  Court Reporter:  Cyndi Chike.  Clerk: J. Mattner.
MINUTES:  Victim rights compliance.  State to recom. prison w/no specific length nor state whether it will be cc or cs to 07CF593 sentence.  Defendant entered a plea of Guilty to Ct 1-Fel Burglary-Bldg or Dwell, Repeater; found guilty by the court.  Ct 2 was dismissed and read-in.  Defendant admits to prior convictions.  PSI report ordered.  Bond continued.  Need writ.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for July 24, 2014 at 02:30 pm.

Defendant Joseph L. Stein appeared with Attorney Kristyne Watson.  Defendant in custody @ KCDC.  Attorney Emily K. Trigg appeared for the Prosecution.  Court Reporter:  Cyndi Chike.  Clerk: J. Mattner.
MINUTES:  Victim rights compliance.  Defense Attorney requesting an adjournment, def. has two SAR hrg's set for 3/19/14 w/Br 3 & 5, and would like this case set over.  Court grants request and sets matter over, bond continued.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for June 4, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Emily Trigg appeared for the State. Def. appeared (in custody) with Atty. Kristyne Watson. Clerk LE.  Plea offer placed on the record by ADA Trigg.  Prelim. waived, probable cause found. Bound over to Br. 4. Information filed, plea of not guilty. Judicial pretrial on 3-13-14 @ 9:00am. Bond continued.
Preliminary Hearing Waiver/Plea Offer
to Preliminary Hearing
filed by Atty Watson

ADA Jason Zapf appeared for the State. Def. appeared (in custody) with Atty. Val Karls for Atty. Kristyne Watson. Clerk LE. Case was scheduled for preliminary hearing this morning. Atty. Watson is unable to appear and requests that preliminary hearing be rescheduled. Time limits tolled for cause due to the unavailability of defense counsel. Preliminary hearing rescheduled to 2-5-14 @ 10:15am. Bond continued.
Atty Kristyne Watson

127pm  Attorney Andrew Burgoyne appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney Kristyne Watson.  Clerk: LE  Defendant requests preliminary hearing within 10 days; set before Comm Mason on 1/28/14 @ 10am.  $10,000  Cash Bond Set w/conditions (see bond entry).  kmk
